messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4335
messages.msgSnippet: I m always amazed when someone says they ve never gone outside, Me too!! I don t suppose they grew up in Alaska or ever climbed a mountain then. hehe Driving
messages.messageBody:
"I'm always amazed when someone says they've never gone outside,"

Me too!! I don't suppose they grew up in Alaska or ever climbed a mountain then. hehe
Driving from Fairbanks to Valdez requires that a person be a bit flexible about facilities for pissing and defecating (or any drive in that great state). And having pursued mountain climbing in former years kept me fairly humble. I was always climbing with men, and you just don't whine about stuff like that.
I've done serious business on Mt.Adams and Mt. Hood both. Mt.Saint Helens was a quick enough climb that you could usually avoid serious stuff, just a pee here and there would getcha through the day.:) I can't tell you how it feels to have your bum hanging over a hole you just dug on a side of a mountain, cold snow all 'round and people climbing up the ridge behind ya. Something you just have to experience for yourself. I CAN tell you it comes out quick, nothing like fear to get things going. sheesh.

Ren
